title: Belarge
author: Belarge
content: As i newbie(beginner) what should I avoid?Is a question I've been wanting to ask because I've also tried to figure out things on my own but the more I try the more it seems deeper and I want to ask the house if there is really some things I have to do stay very active and easily rank up or is just this regular writings? Because I'm not really a good writer

comments.author: Asiska02
comments.body: Quote from: Belarge on February 03, 2023, 09:05:50 PMAs i newbie(beginner) what should I avoid?Avoid plagiarism at all costs, as it is frowned upon by the forum if the main author is not properly cited. Also, refrain from spamming the forum with low-quality posts. Post only when you have something tangible to say or contribute to the forum or discussions, not whenever you feel like it.QuoteIs a question I've been wanting to ask because I've also tried to figure out things on my own but the more I try the more it seems deeper and I want to ask the house if there is really some things I have to do stay very active and easily rank up or is just this regular writings? Because I'm not really a good writer Being active in the forum reflects your willingness to learn new things. Share and contribute ideas, as well as follow-up discussions, in order to become more interactive in the forum.

comments.author: bitmover
comments.body: Quote from: Belarge on February 03, 2023, 09:05:50 PMAs i newbie(beginner) what should I avoid?Just act normally in the forum, having casual conversations and reading more than you write.I don't get how people try to create schemes to rank up, dos and donts.  This is not necessary Just don't spam and don't plagiarize.  Be patient.  And learn and share.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Quote from: Belarge on February 03, 2023, 09:05:50 PMBecause I'm not really a good writer If you arent then try to be one. No one is an excellent writer right away. Everyone has their own mischief and what you could do is to ammend that by learning how to be one. comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Avoid having the mindset of focusing on ranking up. I'm going to bet that you'll perform real bad if that's your sole goal.Also, not good at something? Then work hard to be good at it. Pretty simple.

comments.author: Accardo
comments.body: Quote from: cryptoaddictchie on February 04, 2023, 04:02:11 AMQuote from: Belarge on February 03, 2023, 09:05:50 PMBecause I'm not really a good writer If you arent then try to be one. No one is an excellent writer right away. Everyone has their own mischief and what you could do is to ammend that by learning how to be one. Try to read a lot of books, watch some English tutorials, and see your improvements once in a while.. No one will help you but yourself. One of the ways to improve writing is through consistently writing short articles and that vehicle has helped improve the writing skills of members of this forum. Op's writing is not that difficult to understand, however it's not an article, but a little post that people can easily read and understand. You've got the best advise for him to improve his writing skills, but if he often writes in the forum, given time, he'll be a better writer. Unless he wants to learn use of English, parts of speech, use of words etc he can move to English tutorials on Youtube or join English forums. On the other side, Like others, suggested, I think OP needs to avoid thinking about fast paced method to rank up, It's better to study the forum and understand it before moving ahead to ranking up. Furthermore, quality writing is the only tool for reaching top ranks, as you can't do anything else on the forum without sharing it through threads. Reasonable question effects good responses and such a thing like good questioning can help rank up OP's account in the forum. Generally, OP avoid fake news!

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: Reading is the most rewarding activity. Repetition of the same ideas, such as "Bitcoin is cool; invest in it," or the price forecast to rise or fall, is always very challenging for beginners. Any text can be determined by the sincerity of the writer. If you want to be interesting, be yourself and do not try to talk about what you do not know. It is from this that the advice comes that reading is the best thing to do to understand the mood of the forum. And only after that will you understand what should be done here and what should not.

comments.author: Aliosky
comments.body: Participating in the forum shows that you are interested in learning something new. As a beginner you shouldn’t think of ranking up just share ideas and follow up discussions you will be appreciated and eventually the rank will move. When newbies think of ranking up it mostly leads to spamming and plagiarism which the forum kicks against. Only Make post that will  benefit other forum members.

comments.author: Daniel91
comments.body: OP, why is it important for you to be an active member on this forum and advance to higher ranks?Is there any financial reason for this?There are many members on this forum who, due to their poor knowledge of the English language, write less and much more read the posts of others on the forum or write posts with the help of Google translate or other similar translation tools.You did not write what country you are from and what language you speak? Maybe there is a local board in your language on this forum where you can get more support and be more active?

comments.author: aysg76
comments.body: As others have suggested you lot of good things like avoid plagiarism which will get you nothing but only account ban on the forum so avoid doing it.The best thing that will help you is to treat this forum as discussion platform where you can exchange your knowledge and ideas about bitcoin and related stuff but some people push it as some earning platform through campaign and bounties and start spamming on the forum in hope of getting merits and ranking up without even realising the fact that enhancing your knowledge is key to success here.So just be normal and write posts and be active part of the discussions here which will help you a lot in growing on the forum.

comments.author: hatshepsut93
comments.body: The most important part of ranking up is having knowledge. Writing skill is important to present your knowledge, and with poor writing your knowledge might just get ignored because it's hard to understand. So work on improving your writing skills and learning about the many aspects of Bitcoin. And you also need to form your own opinion, because simply repeating some simple ideas of others won't get you far. You need to be original.

comments.author: nakamura12
comments.body: What you should avoid at all cost is to break any rules in any platform you are using. The second is avoid anything that you didn't have knowledge or you didn't know about it. I can say that if you do is you are like swimming in a vast body of water where we didn't know the danger it has. For being an active member here then as what I have explained is that the rules is the most important to never break ehen your good to go but for other matters then you can guess what I mean about swimming in unknown body of water or in other words read, study, learn and be knowledgeable.

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: Quote from: Belarge on February 03, 2023, 09:05:50 PMAs i newbie(beginner) what should I avoid?Is a question I've been wanting to ask because I've also tried to figure out things on my own but the more I try the more it seems deeper and I want to ask the house if there is really some things I have to do stay very active and easily rank up or is just this regular writings?  Let me just add mine to what others have said so far. I think you should take sometime off posting since you're finding it difficult to post anything right now you should probably just dedicate two or three weeks to learn more about the forum and also watch closely how others make their post and if you're also interested in ranking up and gaining merits then you should also observe those that get plenty of them maybe you could get an idea of how to go about your posting habit and also to figure out what it is that you're missing that's preventing you from achieving what it is that you really want. These are just my 2 cents.

comments.author: Awaklara
comments.body: OP, if you've read the forum rules. you will know what you should avoid. being in a discussion forum, to be honest, you are free to argue and defend your argument. but you also have to be willing to accept input from fellow active members.read more information, then you will get more knowledge that you can use to discuss in the forum. choose information based on your interests and abilities. Learning new things might be interesting, but talking about what we don't master is going to be difficult.
